In terms of the provisions of the Industrial Disputes Act, the Arbitrator is
empowered to make a just and equitable Order. It is the statutory duty of
the Arbitrator to consider whether the Petitioner has acted reasonably and
whether injustice has been caused to the 4th and 5th Respondents. Having
scrutinized  the  said  Award,  it  is  abundantly  clear  that  the  Arbitrator
having  considered  the  evidence  adduced  before  him  has  come  to  a

Typist is unreasonable. Thereafter, the Arbitrator has rightly observed the
